bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 164, Number 120 (Tuesday, July 17, 2018)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. BUDD:H.R. 6403.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, clause 3, providing the power toregulate ``commerce with foreign nations, and among theseveral states.''[Page H6464]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

summary.text: This bill directs the Department of the Treasury to modify financial-institution regulations relating to the collection of beneficial-ownership information from legal entities.

bill.title: To require the Secretary of the Treasury to modify the beneficial ownership requirements by creating an exception for certain accounts.

item.title: To require the Secretary of the Treasury to modify the beneficial ownership requirements by creating an exception for certain accounts.
To require the Secretary of the Treasury to modify the beneficial ownership requirements by creating an exception for certain accounts.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
